body_html:
This will make tensor and Variable sort inconsistent in a different way:

>>> x=torch.randn(10)
>>> y=Variable(x)
>>> x.sort(True)
...
>>> y.sort(True)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/variable.py", line 505, in sort
    return Sort.apply(self, dim, descending, True)
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py", line 524, in forward
    return _MultiSelectionFunction.forward(ctx, input, dim, return_indices, args)
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py", line 497, in forward
    output, indices = fn(*args)
TypeError: sort received an invalid combination of arguments - got (bool, bool), but expected one of:
 * ()
 * (int dim)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (bool, bool)
 * (bool descending)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (bool, bool)
 * (int dim, bool descending)

body:
This will make tensor and Variable sort inconsistent in a different way:
```
>>> x=torch.randn(10)
>>> y=Variable(x)
>>> x.sort(True)
...
>>> y.sort(True)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/variable.py", line 505, in sort
    return Sort.apply(self, dim, descending, True)
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py", line 524, in forward
    return _MultiSelectionFunction.forward(ctx, input, dim, return_indices, args)
  File "/data/users/gchanan/pytorch8a/torch/autograd/_functions/tensor.py", line 497, in forward
    output, indices = fn(*args)
TypeError: sort received an invalid combination of arguments - got (bool, bool), but expected one of:
 * ()
 * (int dim)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (bool, bool)
 * (bool descending)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (bool, bool)
 * (int dim, bool descending)
```
